title: Fine-Tuning MIDI-to-Audio Alignment Using a Neural Network on Piano Roll and CQT Representations
author: Sebastian Murgul (Klangio GmbH), Moritz Reiser (University of Music Karlsruhe), Michael Heizmann (Karlsruhe Institute of Technology), Christoph Seibert (University of Music Karlsruhe), ...
relevance_why: The paper presents a neural network approach for synchronizing audio and MIDI files, which could be useful for enhancing music transcription tasks in Haohe's audio-related research.
background: The task is to align audio recordings of piano performances with loosely aligned MIDI files through a deep learning model.
contribution: This paper introduces a Convolutional Recurrent Neural Network (CRNN) to solve the MIDI-audio alignment problem, achieving up to 20% higher accuracy than standard Dynamic Time Warping methods.

technical_comparison.previous_methods: Dynamic Time Warping, while standard, suffers from limitations in handling longer recordings and aligning frequencies effectively.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work employs a CRNN to analyze both piano roll and audio spectrograms, improving alignment precision and robustness through deep learning.

key_innovation: Combining Convolutional feature extraction with Recurrent neural layers enhances the integration of temporal and spectral information for better alignment.
real_world_impact: The proposed system can significantly streamline the process of music transcription and annotation, benefiting music education, analysis, and performance.
limitations: No explicit limitations are mentioned by the authors.

new_terms.Convolutional Recurrent Neural Network (: **CRNN** is a hybrid architecture that combines Convolutional Neural Networks for feature extraction with Recurrent Neural Networks for sequential data processing.
new_terms.CQT (Constant Q Transform): **CQT** is a spectrogram representation that offers a logarithmic frequency resolution, beneficial for musical applications.
